definitions: To release (someone) from a duty or obligation.
To pardon (a person) for a fault or offense.
To serve as a reason or justification for (an offense or fault).
To make allowances for; to overlook.
To ask for permission to leave.
examples: She tried to excuse her rude behavior.
His illness excuses his poor performance.
Excuse me, I need to make a call.
They excused him from the meeting.
